claims_all.chain_of_thought:
Let me search for evidence of this specific claim about wait times increasing under optimal conditions.

I found this relevant quote: "The number of patients waiting <2 weeks increased significantly for offered (χ[2](1) = 8.83, P < 0.01) and attended (χ[2](1) = 8.88, P < 0.01) assessments if patients were seen under optimal conditions."

This directly supports the specific claim about wait times improving under optimal conditions, with an explicit p-value (p < 0.01).

The claim appears in the main text of the paper, specifically in the "Wait-time target adherence" section of the Results.
claims_all.specific_choice: The number of patients waiting less than 2 weeks for assessment increased under optimal conditions
